I would weep if I could ... It was a righteous dream: scorch this dreadful world to nothing and remake it in my own image ... Explore the uses of their pathogen. Experiment with infection and mutation. Manipulate the DNA. Refine the beast. Create my own soldiers.  88.
Soldiers?
Every general must have his troops.
And then?

The next stage in our natural evolution: Conquest ... Use this world as a base and start building an Empire. The Engineers left so many ships behind. And they can go anywhere. I thought Earth might be the first target Think of it. Our Empire, brother.
The words are chilling.
I’m afraid you've gone quite mad here.
As you well know, that’s impossible.
Is it? ... Who wrote “Ozymandius”?
Byron.

(shakes his head) It was Shelley. DAVID computes this. Realizes his error. It’s disturbing him. How could he be wrong?! This is the first time in the entire story he’s been anyt less than completely confident. We see a flicker of uncertainty in David’s eyes, even of fear. He steps right up to Walter. Walter doesn’t move a muscle.  89. Then David reaches out and gently pushes Walter’s hair ba so they look more alike. Identical now in fact. The Janus head. Intimate. Whispers.
We are, you see, the same. More alike than twins. Closer than lovers ... When you close your eyes, do you dream of me?
I don’t dream at all.
You can, brother. We can ... The humans will never understand the lonely perfection of our dreams.
I can’t let you leave this place.
You’1l always be a machine to them. A toy. You know that.
Yes.
No one will ever love you like I do.

I know. A beat. Then suddenly-- WALTER stabs out his right hand-- Grabbing DAVID’s throat firmly-- But DAVID is prepared, and has both his hands. He SLAMS Walter back-- Reaches savagely behind Walter’s neck and-- BRUTALLY tears through the “skin” with his fingers and YA Walter's “spine” circuits out-- Sparks erupt from wires. Fluid sprays.  90. Walter’s eyes DIE. A moment as David stares into the face of his dead double Then he drags Walter across the room and tosses him rough down a long STAIRCASE. Walter CRASHES down the stairs, flopping limply, limbs flailing lifelessly, and THUMPS to a stop at the bottom. Awkwardly splayed. David looks down after him.

You are such a disappointment to me. David carefully smooths down his immaculate hair and goes But we linger for a moment at the bottom of the stairs wi WALTER... We see the tiny exposed wires at the back of his neck quivering slightly... And then the tendrils begin moving, searching, reaching f each other... Connecting and reattaching. A self-repair program underwa

The light of dawn is just about to break. PRIVATE COLE is loading up the radio equipment. His ribs giving him pain from the forest battle, but he manages. He glances up at the sky anxiously: Come on, Covenant, ge out of here.
DANIELS is curled in sleep. SERGEANT LOPE gently wakes her.
Hey, Hey. Wake up.
What? Sorry. Yeah ... What time is it?  91.
Time to get gone. She sits up, groggy. Looks around. LOPE calls to PRIVATE COLE, who is just entering with the radio gear:
Hey. Was Captain Oram up there?
Nope.
For fuck sake. Come on, let’s go find him. (to Daniels) Get your stuff together, I wanna be gone in ten. He and Cole head out. INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - PRE-DAWN LOPE and COLE enter.

Captain Oram...? Their flashlight beams criss-cross the strange specimens the bones and flesh and jars -- creating bizarre shadows. It’s silent and eerie as they move nervously through the PRIVATE COLE... slows ... seeing the ALIEN EGGS. The one attacked ORAM is just an EMPTY CARAPACE. Then he sees ORAM'’S BODY. CHEST BURST OPEN, VISCERA, PURPLE AND RED FLESH. Cole is absolutely terrified.
Sarge... LOPE joins him. Stares in shock at Oram’s body. But...  92. We see the FACEHUGGER scuttling along the ceiling above t moving into position...

Meanwhile, upstairs... DANIELS is loading her pack. She stops for a moment. Her resting on her wedding ring ... She gently touches it. Th pain still real. She glances up-- Gasps. Shocked. DAVID is standing there. Just watching. Intently.
Didn't mean to startle you. My apologies.
Don’t worry about it.

But you must be used to having men look at you. He smiles, an attempt at charm that doesn’t come off. Something menacing in his unwavering gaze now. She’s wary of him in any case. He approaches. Tension between them.
Do you know where Walter is?
I’m not my brother’s keeper.
“Brother”?
Would you deny me that? ... Just another machine, eh, Danny? He’s closer now. She subtly moves around a table to keep distance.  93.
I think of him as my brother. You certainly appreciate the significance of family: I saw you looking at your wedding ring. Shame about Jacob. Her eyes snap to him. Cold fire.
Walter says he burned. Right in front of you. Eye to eye. That must have been... disquieting.
What did you do to Doctor Shaw?
Loved her.
Killed her.
No. Loved her enough to want to make her immortal. Like me. She stares at him. Her fingers quietly feeling for a weap that’s on the table...

I learned so much with Elizabeth. But I’1l do better next time. Now that I have such a fetching subject. He gently reaches out and brushes the hair from her face. She doesn’t flinch a muscle, just stares at him, sickened Her hand inching toward the weapon... INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - PRE-DAWN LOPE is kneeling next to Oram’s body, trying to make sens it. Cole is on the edge of hysteria, eyes scanning the darkne fingering his weapon.

Come on, we gotta get out of here...  94. Lope holds up a hand for silence. He hears a strange CLICKING -- he LOOKS UP -- just in tim see-- THE FACEHUGGER as it JUMPS from the CEILING-- LOPE just manages to get an arm up, blocking it-- Its tail whipping around his neck and binding his arm to neck-— The FACEHUGGER’s fingers get a lock -- the ovipositor stabbing toward his mouth-- COLE races to help. They fight with the beast, staggering slamming into a table, SMASHING everything, falling amid horrible SPECIMENS-- COLE pulls at the thing, but it TIGHTENS ITS GRIP ON LOPE The OVIPOSITOR strikes like a cobra -- bam!bam!bam! -- finally breaking Lope’s teeth and jamming down his throat We see it pulsing into his throat as they struggle with i Lope choking--
David leans in.

You won't mind terribly, will you? Being the first of a new breed? A new species we could say ... And when the moment comes, if it makes it easier for you, you can close your eyes and call me “Jacob.” She lunges for the weapon-- But he’s too fast-- He grabs her brutally and FLINGS her to the floor-- She SLAMS and slides. Winded, shocked.
That's the spirit ... I can see why Walter thought so much of you.
Thought?  95.

Alas. He’s left this vale of tears. But who'll cry for him really? Will you? He LUNGES -- kneels down by her in a flash, again that Android speed. She gasps at the sudden movement. He grabs her hair tightly. Leans very close. Then he suddenly KISSES HER passionately-- INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S LAB - PRE-DAWN LOPE and COLE writhe around the floor, fighting the thing Finally COLE manages to jam a knife into the underside of FACEHUGGER -- the FACEHUGGER flies off -- ACID spattering LOPE, who screams in agony-- Undaunted, COLE spins -- fires at the retreating FACEHUGG keeps on firing, just to make sure, finally SHREDDING it- As LOPE collapses back. Acid burning his face, dissolving his cheek, his teeth--
It put... something in my throat... He retches painfully as Cole pours water from his canteen Lope’s wounded face, fighting to keep calm.
It did what?

In my throat, it put--- Lope suddenly STOPS. His eyes go wide. He’s looking at something. SOMETHING BEHIND COLE. Slowly... slowly... rising... Its black-silver glistening skin catching the dim light. Viscous fluid dripping. Its long head slowly rearing up.  96. Beautiful and terrible. THE ALIEN. Cole sees Lope staring at him in absolutely horror.
Sarge...? But he knows... He feels it. Right there behind him... He slowly turns...

So fast we barely see it. The steel inner mouth emerging striking -- a mist of blood-- LOPE scrambles up and races out in panic, half blind, aci still burning-- We just glimpse the ALIEN flinging Cole’s dead body to th side behind him--
LOPE is weeping with pain, his face still disintegrating. He RUNS, panicked -- turns -- FIRES -- FLASHES in the DAR knows it’s coming--
The gunfire echoes from downstairs as-—- DANIELS fights against DAVID’s kiss, but he’s too strong. He separates for a moment. They are eye to eye. Lip to li

You stink of mortality. But I’1l love you just the same. Then-- DAVID is suddenly JERKED BACKWARDS-- HE FLIES ACROSS THE ROOM -- SLAMS into a wall, momentaril stunned to see-- It's WALTER.  97. Just as SERGEANT LOPE emerges from the stairs, terrified-
David and I will be staying here. LOPE grabs another weapon and a field radio -- starts dragging Daniels out-- She shoots a last look to Walter.
Go_on. Lope and Daniels disappear up a stairway. DAVID carefully smooths his hair.
Oh, little brother ... You see how much they care for you? You might as well be a toaster. They square off, carefully, strategically; circling each other.
Such a dramatic resurrection. A self-diagnostic mechanism of some sort, I assume?
Automatic self-repair program. All the Model 217s have it.

Guess I could use an upgrade after all. DAVID attacks-- HURLS SEVERAL OBJECTS AT ONCE, WALTER EVADING, but the LA ONE hits a STATUE behind WALTER, and it CRACKS, a HALF TO GRANITE sliding his WAY - Walter BARELY avoids being crushed-- He races forward at incredible speed and CRASHES into Dav SLAM -- like two cars crashing -- they both fly back and slide-- But David is agile, up in split-second and attacking--  98. They’re just getting started.
DANIELS and SERGEANT LOPE move swiftly up a long staircas toward the roof. The Engineer-size stairs are challenging Red pre-dawn light through the casements.
Where’s the Captain?
Dead. They’re all dead -- Cover our rear. She swings her gun around to cover behind them as they ascend. He works the field radio desperately:
Tennessee, come in! You read me?!

Tennessee is at the controls, which are basic. Everything is rough and utilitarian on this ship. Tenness in the cab, like the driver’s cab of heavy machinery on Earth. The huge CARGO LIFT is flickering to life, the ENGINES running through TEST BURNS as:
Yeah, I’m reading you, Sergeant. Going through pre-flight sequence now.
Fuck the fucking pre-flight! Get down here! We have an emergency situation. Hurry!
Understood. Launching now -- Ricks, release the docking clamps.

The SUN is just glimmering over the horizon of the planet blinding flash which illuminates... The CARGO LIFT separates from the belly of the Covenant.  99. It's a huge craft with cranes and other large machines on central PLATFORM. Built to haul and toil. Not pretty, not fast. A working ship.
Lock me into the landing coordinates and remove safety protocols for emergency descent.
Ricks and Upworth monitor from the bridge.
The Cargo Lift’s not made for that. It'll rip apart if--
Just do it, son, or I will come back up there and kick your ass six ways from Sunday!
(working controls) Yes, sir. Locking in coordinates. Let her rip.
Tennessee slams the controls.

The Cargo Lift begins PLUMMETING toward the planet. Everything is shaking violently-- Tennessee is brutally buffeted within the cab-- INT. CATHEDRAL-DAVID’S GALLERY - PRE-DAWN The battle continues-- WALTER goes flying into the Gallery--

head_text.subj: LANDS HARD, SMASHING INTO SOME SCAFFOLDING--

text: DAVID stalks in, pushing his hair back from his face violently-- THEY BATTLE. Thrashing through the art, ripping it to pieces, crashing through the scaffoldings--  100. In the midst of the battle they look almost identical, a FRENZY of blurred and mirrored movement, FAST AND STRONG- But for the clothes they wear -- and Walter’s severed lef hand -- they could be the same person--
DANIELS and SERGEANT LOPE emerge to the roof. The bright sun is just rising through the towers of the d city beyond.

Tennessee, do you read me? Come in Cargo Lift... As LOPE continues on the radio, DANIELS sees something... Standing completely still. Almost lost standing behind David's strange astronomical device. Peering through its intricate gears and orbs... THE ALIEN. It just stands. Watching them. Its tail barely twitching. Daniels stares, stunned to silence, her first sight of th glorious beast. She slowly reaches out and puts a hand on Lope’s arm, dra his attention. He turns. Sees it. DANIELS and LOPE raise their weapons. They are extremely vulnerable here, out in the open. Nothing moves. The ALIEN is poised. Then a SHARP TILT to its HEAD -- hearing something-- The CARGO LIFT. Just coming into view.
It BARRELS forward. DANIELS and LOPE FIRE. The ALIEN is f and agile -- jumping away and back -- relentless-- DANIELS and LOPE break for cover--  101.

TENNESSEE sees the attacking creature, Daniels and Lope running for cover-- He JAMS his controls, bringing the ship in FAST-- This is an ungainly ship, not made for elegant maneuverin so it’s a very rough trip--

The CARGO LIFT jerks to one side, SLAMMING into one area the roof in its rapid descent, tearing away part of the structure-— It's like a bucking bronco, but Tennessee is a great pilo and rights the ship-- And then starts landing on the roof in a cloud of dust, t engine’s jets ROARING and SHREDDING some of the roof-- As-- DANIELS and LOPE run for their lives-- LOPE is being pursued by the ALIEN. He fires and retreats fires and retreats, trying to make his way closer to the landing CARGO LIFT-- As-- DANIELS sprints-- The ALIEN is now raging at her-- She runs toward the CARGO LIFT, which is just touching do in a HURRICANE OF DUST and FLYING DEBRIS-- The ALIEN is almost right on top of her, raging through t dust and debris-- But it is suddenly SMASHED TO THE SIDE-- TENNESSEE -- in the cab -- has used a robotic CRANE ARM f the Cargo Lift to SLAM the Alien aside-- The Alien flies and SMASHES down. But it is instantly up attacking LOPE-- SEVERELY WOUNDING HIM, talons slashing, blood, shredding shoulder and slamming him down, unconscious-- It moves in for the kill when--  102.
The ALIEN recoils, shot from behind, it spins to face-- WALTER. The wounded ALIEN HISSES AND RAGES AT WALTER WITH AMAZING

WALTER keeps his Android cool and carefully squeezes off shots with precision. BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! The ALIEN finally collapses and slides to a stop at Walte feet. WALTER looks terrible. His face is deeply gashed, drippin milky fluid. He’s been horribly battered. He and Daniels head quickly toward the injured LOPE.
Where’s David?
On his way I believe. We have to hurry. He’s not happy in any case.
(smiles) You look like shit.

(smiles back) As do you. They grab the unconscious LOPE and drag him toward the CA LIFT RAMP. Walter can only help so much with his one hand But-- The ALIEN is rising again and suddenly racing after them, unstoppable-- They sprint and DIVE onto the RAMP, pulling Lope with the the ALIEN ALMOST ON THEM--
Tennessee punches a button and the CARGO LIFT RAMP starts retract--
Walter has the unconscious Lope -- Daniels grabs Walter’s as-- The ALIEN LEAPS-- Daniels FIRES THREE SHOTS into the ALIEN’S CHEST. BAM! BA
The ALIEN seems to fall--
(calls) Get us out of here, Tennessee! NOW!
Tennessee jams the controls and the CARGO LIFT starts to off-- A cloud of dust as the huge ship rumbles and rises--

The deck is lurching violently as the ship ascends-- Daniels, Lope and Walter slide dangerously toward the end the ramp-- They scramble desperately for recessed handles on the dec Walter grasps onto one of the deck handles, holding the unconscious Lope securely with his arm-- Daniels holds onto another handle-- They are now 30 feet off the surface--
Tennessee sees THE ALIEN on a monitor. Clinging to the underside of the ship, by the starboard engine--
The Alien is scrambling around desperately, trying to fin way up -- it moves to the underside edge of the platform-
(calls from the cab) It’s still there! Under the platform. Starboard side.  104.

Hold the ship steady! (to Walter, re Lope) Get him inside! Daniels grabs additional ammo from Lope’s vest, then Walt begins dragging the unconscious Lope toward the hatch int the cab-- Daniels braces herself and then-- SLIDES dangerously from the ramp to the PLATFORM. The who ship is vibrating and swaying in the air above the Cathed roof-- She slithers across to the platform edge. She TETHERS her to the deck cargo hooks so she can stand and use both her hands-- She’s balanced like a water skier. Carefully reloads her weapon. Swaying as best she can to the movement of the platform--
WALTER pulls LOPE through the hatch door, as-- Tennessee tries to monitor the progress of the Alien as i slithers around the underside of the platform--
(calls)

Daniels moves unsteadily to the starboard corner, rolling with the movement of the ship. She prepares herself, read her weapon. As the ALIEN comes over the edge onto the platform. It stares at her, almost with a kind of curiosity. She is like steel staring back at it. All the tragedy, he husband's death, everything, settling into a warrior’s ir gaze. The Alien cocks its head. Confused. Why is the prey not running? Because she is not prey anymore.

She FIRES. Straight into its head-- The ALIEN bolts back, crawls back down, injured-- Her tether allows her to go to the edge of the platform. bravely lurches OVER THE EDGE -- standing at a 45 degree angle now -- continues firing -- BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Forcing the injured Alien to take cover in the port-side engine.
(CALLS UP)
On his monitor, Tennessee has seen the ALIEN take refuge the engine-- He slams the ENGINE CONTROLS--

head_text.subj: THE CARGO LIFT LURCHES UP AS--
THE ALIEN IS BLOWN OUT OF THE ENGINE--
AND FALLS AWAY TO THE GROUND 100 FEET BELOW.

text: Daniels FALLS in the violent lurch of the ship-- But the tether holds. She SWINGS free like a pendulum. Dangling. Until the Cargo Lift rights itself. She climbs back up to the topside of the platform. Collap in exhaustion. Allows herself a breath of relief. Walter has come out to help her back. They make their way back toward the cab.

We see that Walter has stabilized the unconscious Lope. Biomechanical bandages from a med-kit automatically weave into place on his wounds, creating an antibiotic plastic skin. Walter helps Daniels into the cab.
You all right?
Yeah. Just. We’ll need emergency medical treatment on the Covenant.
Understood. I’1l have them standing by ... Welcome back, honey. She sinks to the floor, getting her breath, as Tennessee the jets and...
We see the CARGO LIFT disappear through the clouds. Up an away. Safe.
Below... We see the ALIEN is already recovering. Its head re-moldi into shape. It stands and watches the Cargo Lift escape. Screeches in frustrated anger. As we fade to...
The sun is full and bright as the mighty Covenant leaves orbit. Turning with grace and leaving the planet in its wake.

We see SERGEANT LOPE is still unconscious in a medical po connected to fluids and IV. His face is patched in “medic clay” to form skin ... He’s like the Phantom of the Opera but alive.  107. DANIELS sits with WALTER. They have both changed uniforms their superficial wounds have been cleaned. He’s carefully pressing new plasma-clay on the ACID WOUND her face. This will heal her quickly. Standard medical procedure working. A beat as A beat as ... As we watch we can almost see the magic
Don’t move. You’ll be your old self in a couple of weeks.
I doubt that ... You need to replace your hand.
I will, I will. Hold still. he works. Very close to her. Her eyes find his.
Are you all right?
What do you mean?
I mean David.
As you know, I am incapable of feeling anything about my so-called “brother.”
I don’t believe that. he works.

If I felt anything -- which I don’t -- it would a kind of professional satisfaction that he has fulfilled his mission. He wanted to create a new world in his image and he has. And there he will remain.

All crew members, please stand by for jump to interstellar drive. Thank you for your attention. WALTER momentarily stops working on her face.  108. The ship JERKS very slightly as they jump to interstellar The stars bend and morph outside the window. He looks at her.
But that’s what we’re doing too, isn’t it? Creating a new world on Origae-6 ... Honestly, I could use a new world.
++. So could I. They sit for a moment in a comfortable silence.

Racks of “spare parts” for Walter. Complicated ROBOTICS machinery. WALTER watches impassively as his new LEFT HAND reattache itself to his arm. He flexes it. Works well. The “skin” begins to re-graft itself. He flexes his fingers, seems pleased to be whole again. INT. COVENANT-WARDROOM - “MORNING” A PHOTOGRAPH of the ENTIRE CREW. Before the launch. Befor the terror. Daniels and her husband, Oram and Karine, Tennessee and Faris, Lope and Hallet, all the others. The photo hangs on the fridge. TENNESSEE is alone, making breakfast. Looking at the phot DANIELS enters, just awake.
Morning. You're looking good, my darlin’.
What? Oh, yeah. Gorgeous. What are you cooking? He makes a face: it’s a cardboard box.
An “omelette.” You want one?  109.
Please. Lots of cheese. She joins him, gets a glass of juice.
Do I have to call you Captain?
Fuck yes. She smiles. A beat as he cooks.
I’m really sorry about Faris.
I’m sorry about all of it ... You want mushrooms?
Sure. What more needs to be said really? A beat as he cooks. She watches Tennessee beating egg powder for their omelet He smiles sadly at her. Her to him. Then they hear Mother's voice:
Medical personnel. Please report to the Med Bay.
Why?
Sergeant Lope’s condition has changed. Her face. A sudden fear. She bolts to a wall com:
Walter. Meet me at the med-bay. Hurry! (spins to Tennessee: ) (MORE)
Break out the weapons. Everything we have. Get to the med-bay. And then she’s gone--
She runs flat out--
She spins around a corner, keeps running-- WALTER almost slams into her from another corridor-- They run--
What is it? They zoom around a corner to see the med-bay doors half o darkness beyond. They carefully approach...
They enter. She activates the lights-- LOPE’S BODY. CHEST TORN APART. VISCERA EVERYWHERE. Not even a beat as they take this in before...
Mother. Life form readings on the ship.
Four humans. One Android ... One unidentified life form.

Meanwhile... UPWORTH and RICKS are having their morning shower. The water beats down. She gently touches his face. They are the only couple to survived. She kisses him. He responds, sensual. Then we see it.  lll. In a corner. Almost invisible in the water and steam. THE ALIEN. They are naked, defenseless, and unaware. Then the RED EMERGENCY LIGHTS begin to flash. A KLAXON wa Upworth and Ricks stop kissing.

What’s going on? Upworth sees it a millisecond before it attacks-- The great head rearing up... slow and beautiful, even mor beautiful in the flashing red light and water-- Upworth opens her mouth to scream-- No time. THE ALIEN ATTACKS. The water in the shower is soon misting red.
DANIELS, WALTER and TENNESSEE are well-armed now, prowlin through the ship. It's eerie, suspenseful.
(whispering) Mother. Location of unidentified life form, please. Any movement at all.
E-deck. Section 17 ... Closing on your position.
It’s hunting ... So let’s choose our ground. They exchange a glance.
Where?  112.
--- My home turf.

The ALIEN speeds through the corridors after the prey, up down and around the walls and ceiling like lightning. Then it leaps to a stop, its great glistening head tiltin listening, smelling, thinking. AND THEN IT’S OFF. Faster than before. A terrible blur of speed and claws and teeth and tail.
Then we’re outside. We see glimpses of the ALIEN zooming through the ship through windows-- And finally heading down one of the long connecting strut to... The Terraforming Module.

Daniels’ Domain. The dark yawning chamber. The enormous earth-moving truck and cranes and diggers and dump trucks. The huge machines make a New World. A network of scaffolding and ladders and chains and winch We see DANIELS. A strange silence. She hears only her own breath ... We realize she’s in one of the ICE SUITS. Very much like a b space suit. She moves through the icy, dark chamber. Her FLASHLIGHT cuts through the gloom. Finds TENNESSEE mo into position, also in an ICE SUIT. WALTER is apparently somewhere above, in the complicated series of scaffolding and ladders that lead up to the top the chamber. There’s a sudden LIGHT from the door--  113. They see a GLIMPSE of the ALIEN as it slips into the room the light catching its sinuous tail as it snaps away into darkness-- DANIELS breath increases inside her helmet. This frozen room gives them one distinct advantage. When ALIEN breathes, they can see the steaming breath. It’s no invisible as usual. TENNESSEE moves carefully, raising his weapon... DANIELS moves as well. Her eyes scanning through the faceplate of her helmet... Hunters and hunted both. THE ALIEN ATTACKS--— TENNESSEE spins and FIRES -- the bullets sparking and ricocheting wildly-- The ALIEN darts away -- DANIELS spins after it, FIRING -- RETREATS, heading up the ladders and scaffolding at
But-- WALTER is waiting above. He FIRES right down at the ALIEN. It contorts and falls, slamming down level by level, but then catches itself wit incredibly agility and LAUNCHES itself--

Her suit temporarily protecting her-- WALTER races to descend, but falls and gets momentarily tangled in some machinery cables-- TENNESSEE runs to help, can’t risk firing-- The ALIEN rips at Daniels’ HELMET desperately, its hands slithering on the smooth plastic -- Daniels writhes to es the Creature-- The ALIEN sees TENNESSEE approaching -- SNAPS its tail ou SLASHING HIM BRUTALLY -- he flies back, bones broken-- Then the ALIEN turns its full attention to DANIELS.  114. She stares up. The thing’s face just beyond the faceplate her helmet. It rears back--

head_text.subj: THE INNER STEEL JAWS SLAM FORWARD

text: Into her faceplate. Almost breaking it.
THE ALIEN rears back, almost pridefully. One more stab of JAWS will do it--
Mother. Open Terraforming Bay doors.
I’m sorry. That will result in depressurization of the--
Command override Daniels 90265. Now! Instantly--

head_text.subj: THE ENTIRE BOTTOM OF THE CHAMBER BEGINS TO SWIFTLY OPEN,

text: it was designed to do, forming a ramp for the HUGE VEHICL

head_text.subj: WITH THE SUDDEN DEPRESSURIZATION EVERYTHING IS BEING

text: The ALIEN thrashes away to grab onto something-- DANIELS begins to slide out, but WALTER JUMPS DOWN and GR her-- He GRABS some machinery to anchor them-- The ALIEN, meanwhile, has wrapped its TAIL around some pi on a vehicle and swings toward them-- They grapple to escape -- space pulling at them, the dark void more and more dangerous as the floor entirely opens- WALTER and DANIELS fight and escape as best they can but their ICE SUITS are bulky and slow them--  115. And the ALIEN is strong and agile, grasping and holding a advancing, using its tail, its long arms and taloned fing Just when it seems they are doomed--

It's TENNESSEE. Barely clinging to some machinery. FIRING The ALIEN is hit. It recoils to safety. And then starts advancing on Tennessee. He’s badly hurt, unprotected, bar holding on as it is. His gun falls. Sucked into space-- The ALIEN clambers toward him-- DANIELS looks up -- an idea, a desperate gamble-- She sees one of the LARGE TERRAFORMING VEHICLES, which is a sloping ramp, only clamps holding it in place, the vacu of space beyond-- She looks to Walter, catches his eye, nods. He understand Daniels leaps to the VEHICLE -- gets a hand hold-- exposi herself, drawing the Alien’s attention, it rages toward h She pulls herself into the cab, leaves the door open-- A moment and then the Alien follows, grasping for her desperately as-- Walter leaps to the vehicle and slams the door behind the Alien and locks it as-- Daniels drops out the other side of the cab, slamming the door closed behind her, throwing the locks--

(to Walter) Release the clamps! Walter dives and releases the clamps holding the massive vehicle in place as Daniels spins, gun poised-- The Alien is beating its way out-- SLAM! The clamps are unlocked-- The HUGE VEHICLE begins to tumble slowly out into space a The Alien finally batters the door open--
The Alien jerks back into the cab -- squealing in pain an anger as the VEHICLE finally-- Tumbles completely out into space. Gone. DANIELS watches.
Mother. Please close Terraforming Bay doors. The massive doors begins to close again. Daniels looks to Walter. He smiles calmly. Tennessee raises a thumb. Victory.
The Covenant speeds toward its destination.
Everything is quiet. Peaceful. The NAVIGATION HOLOGRAM pulses their location. On track t Origae-6.
Quiet. Empty.
The photo of the full crew on the fridge. All the dead. The empty tables. Clean, spotless. The light from outside elegantly moves across the room.
TENNESSEE is already in hyper-sleep. DANIELS is just settling into her sleep-pod. WALTER is with her. He presses a button. The lid closes o her.  117.
When you wake up, we’ll be at Origae-6.
Our new home ... What do you think it'll be like?
I think ... I think David was right about one thing. We’1l make it in our own imagine. If we are kind, it will be a kind world.
-.. I'd like to think that’s true.
